meanings.definition: A type of paper money issued during the French Revolution.
meanings.sent1: During the French Revolution, people used assignats to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: The assignats were printed with intricate designs to prevent counterfeiting.
meanings.sent3: The assignats in the history book looked like colorful pieces of art.
meanings.sent4: The assignats fluttered in the wind like fragile autumn leaves.
meanings.sent5: The value of assignats fluctuated wildly, causing economic chaos.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer property or rights to someone else.
meanings.sent1: She decided to assignats her old car to her younger brother.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer helped them assignats the ownership of the house.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would assignats his chores to the family dog.
meanings.sent4: The power of attorney allowed her to assignats her legal rights temporarily.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to assignats their seats for the group project.
